intro: Acerates rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's acerates, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in the late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acerates rusbyi is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
